facts: Insects have six legs and a body divided into three parts: head, thorax, and abdomen.
Bees use a waggle dance to tell other bees the direction and distance to good flowers.
Butterflies and many other insects go through metamorphosis, changing from larva to adult.
Some ants can carry objects many times heavier than their own body weight.
Dragonflies are fast flyers and can catch other insects in midair.
Many insects breathe through tiny openings called spiracles along the sides of their bodies.
Fireflies make light using a chemical reaction in their bodies, a glow called bioluminescence.
